newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RAINBOW CHICKEN SAYS CAN'T PREDICT 2ND HALF.
newsitem.headline: RAINBOW CHICKEN SAYS CAN'T PREDICT 2ND HALF.

text.p: Struggling broiler producer Rainbow Chicken Ltd said on Thursday it was impossible to give an indication of second half prospects.
The company said it had made some headway with an action programme announced earlier this year involving substantial investment which would not be completed before December 1997.
"Some progress has already been made in this direction but much still has to be achieved," the companmy said in a statement with half year results.
"A meaningful indication of the expected results for the second half of the year cannot be given at this time."

The attributable loss in the six months to end-September increased to 164.4 million rand from 57.2 million a year ago. The company had warned in August that it faced a 165 million rand loss in the period.

Rainbow said it had been hit by low prices and rising feed costs, a situation aggravated by the fall in the rand. However, the group's previously excessive stock levels returned to normal in September and chicken prices have since firmed.
Rainbow received a 550.3 million rand cash injection following a rights issue on September 30 and a final 118.0 million on October 3.

Earlier this week Jorge Antonio Del Corral Ibarrondo was appointed as the new managing director, effective from mid-November. Del Corral was formerly chief executive of Mexico's Bachoco SA, one of the largest producers of broilers, eggs and pork in Latin America.
